data_structures: integer variables for sum and min
algorithm_technique: Greedy approach: the maximum score is achieved by removing elements such that the sum of the two smallest elements (or the single smallest if odd length) is minimized.
problem_summary_simple: Maximize score by repeatedly removing two elements from either end or both ends of an array.
problem_summary_technical: Greedy strategy: for even length, minimize the sum of the two smallest elements. For odd length, remove the single smallest element.
key_insights: The problem can be solved greedily by observing that we want to maximize the sum of removed elements.
This is equivalent to minimizing the sum of the elements that remain in the array.
For an even number of elements, we want to leave the two smallest elements. For an odd number, we want to leave the single smallest element.
